Quotes: The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Every war when it comes, or before it comes, is represented not as a war but as an act of self-defense against a homicidal maniac.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: A flow of words is a sure sign of duplicity.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: Nothing is pleasant that is not spiced with variety.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: The art of acting consists in keeping people from coughing.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: The best actors do not let the wheels show.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: I often quote myself. It adds spice to my conversation.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: In making a speech one must study three points: first, the means of producing persuasion;second, the language;third the proper arrangement of the various parts of the speech.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: Moral excellence comes about as a result of habit. We become just by doing just acts, temperate by doing temperate acts, brave by doing brave acts.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: He who has a task to perform must know how to take sides, or he is quite unworthy of it.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: I hold the world but as the world, Gratiano;A stage where every man must play a part, And mine is a sad one.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: I am acquainted with no immaterial sensuality so delightful as good acting.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: It's no secret that we were sticking just about every nickel we had on the chance that people would really be interested in something totally new and unique in the field of entertainment.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: We allow no geniuses around our Studio.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: Of all of our inventions for mass communication, pictures still speak the most universally understood language.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: Think before you act and act on what you believe.
Author: Bo Bennett
